history.content:
The closest thing you'll get to 182 is Stanford's CS 231n, since 182 is a slight reworking of it. You can fully access all of CS 231n material and lectures here: http://cs231n.stanford.edu/

That's not to say MIT's course isn't similar. But if you were planning on self studying, 231n is your best bet and one of the best deep learning courses out there.
===
182 also contains content from http://web.stanford.edu/class/cs224n/ and http://rail.eecs.berkeley.edu/deeprlcourse/, but I would definitely start with 231n

The closest thing you'll get to 182 is Stanford's CS 231n, since 182 is a slight reworking of it. You can fully access all of CS 231n material and lectures here: http://cs231n.stanford.edu/

That's not to say MIT's course isn't similar. But if you were planning on self studying, 231n is your best bet and one of the best deep learning courses out there.

Hey, I was wondering if anyone has looked at this MIT course, https://medium.com/tensorflow/mit-introduction-to-deep-learning-4a6f8dde1f0c. If anyone has taken 182 at Cal, could you please comment on if they cover much of the same material or if they are different (would taking one over the other be enough)? The lectures for the MIT course are available here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5v1JnYv_yWs&list=PLtBw6njQRU-rwp5__7C0oIVt26ZgjG9NI
history.subject: Similarity of MIT course 6.S191 - Intro to Deep Learning
